prd.oneLiner: Semantic + structural diff engine for web-first languages, usable as CLI + Git external diff + GitHub overlay extension.

endGoal.summary: Replace legacy line-based diffs with AST/structure-aware diffs + semantic normalization + refactor/move visibility, across CLI/Git/GitHub.

principles: Correctness > cleverness: never hide meaningful changes
Modular parsers per language + guaranteed fallback
Effect-first architecture: services, layers, schemas, typed errors

needs: better PR diff in GitHub UI

useCases: Run semantic diff between two files
Use as git external diff tool (git diff, git show --ext-diff, git log -p --ext-diff)
See moved blocks + edits inside moved blocks
Reduce noise from Tailwind class reordering in JSX/TSX/HTML
Open GitHub PR semantic overlay; navigate to native diff; add/resolve comments; report extension bugs

explicitNonGoals: Type-only diff mode (types always matter; no hiding TS type changes)
Supporting non-Chromium browsers for the extension

coreEngine.desc: Parse both sides into language trees when possible; else fallback.
acceptance: Unsupported/invalid parse never crashes; falls back to text diff
Parser choice is pluggable per language
Parser pipeline supports fallback chain per language

coreEngine.desc: Tree/structure-aware diff producing stable edit operations.
acceptance: Formatting-only changes produce minimal/no semantic edits (where safe)
Output includes node ranges (line/col) for old/new

coreEngine.desc: Detect moved blocks and show edits inside moved blocks.
acceptance: Moved blocks are identified as moves, not delete+add when match confidence high
Edits inside moved blocks displayed as nested changes

coreEngine.desc: Detect repeated identifier rename patterns and group them.
acceptance: Repeated consistent identifier mapping is summarized (and optionally collapsible in renderers)

coreEngine.desc: Language-aware normalizers reduce noise without hiding meaningful changes.
acceptance: All normalizers are opt-in/out via config (global + per-language)
Normalizer rules are conservative; include rule-level tests

coreEngine.desc: Treat Tailwind class list reordering as no-op in static class strings.
acceptance: For JSX/TSX/HTML attributes class/className with static string, token order changes do not create diffs
Add/remove/change tokens still diffs
Rule can be disabled globally/per-project/per-language

cli.desc: CLI built with @effect/cli; fully typed args/options; auto-help.
acceptance: All commands produce deterministic stdout/stderr
Exit codes: 0 success; nonzero only for internal errors (git external mode must not fail on differences)

cli.desc: Commands for diffing, git integration, diagnostics, and machine output.

commands.difftool: semadiff difftool (wrapper compatible with git difftool env vars)
commands.installGit: semadiff install-git (prints git config snippets + verification commands)
commands.bench: semadiff bench (runs local benchmarks + baseline compare)
commands.explain: semadiff explain (why diff chose a match/move/rename; emits JSON)

acceptance: Supports ANSI renderer by default; plain and JSON outputs available
Supports reading stdin for one/both inputs (optional)
Binary files handled gracefully (no crash; informative output)

gitIntegration.desc: Works as git external diff (7-arg contract).
acceptance: Works with git diff and git show/log when configured as diff.external (with --ext-diff where required by user)
Handles /dev/null for added/removed files
Does not depend on legacy Git behavior; tested against latest Git in CI

gitIntegration.desc: Docs + helper command to configure global/per-repo usage.
acceptance: install-git prints minimal config and a verification checklist
Docs include external diff + difftool setups

renderers.desc: Readable terminal diff for structure-aware output.
acceptance: Supports unified and side-by-side modes (configurable)
Has stable formatting suitable for snapshot tests

renderers.desc: Machine-readable JSON diff output for tooling/extension reuse.
acceptance: JSON schema defined and versioned
Includes operations: insert/delete/update/move + metadata

renderers.desc: HTML renderer used by GitHub overlay (and optional CLI output to file).
acceptance: Renders without external network
Supports large diffs via virtualization

githubExtension.desc: Chrome/Edge MV3 extension adds a semantic-diff overlay on GitHub PR 'Files changed'.
acceptance: Overlay toggled by button + shortcut
Overlay lists files changed; lazy-load diff per file
Overlay uses same engine as CLI (shared packages)

githubExtension.desc: Fetch base/head file contents for each changed file, compute semantic diff locally.
acceptance: Uses authenticated GitHub page context; no token storage
Graceful handling for large files and unavailable blobs

githubExtension.desc: Bridge from overlay to native GitHub actions: jump to line, open comment UI, resolve thread (via native UI).
acceptance: Clicking a node/line in overlay can scroll/highlight matching region in GitHub diff
Comment action opens GitHub's native comment UI on nearest relevant line (no wrong-line comments)
Resolve action navigates to and triggers GitHub native resolve where available

githubExtension.desc: In-overlay bug report flow for extension issues.
acceptance: Creates a diagnostic bundle (sanitized) + opens a prefilled GitHub issue link OR copies to clipboard
User must explicitly confirm any inclusion of code snippets; default is metadata-only

githubExtension.desc: Feature-flagged full replacement of GitHub diff blocks (optional mode).
acceptance: Feature-flagged; off by default until stable
Has dedicated e2e suite due to DOM brittleness

githubExtension.desc: Create/resolve comments directly via GitHub APIs (GraphQL/REST) from overlay.
acceptance: No secret persistence; uses in-page auth + CSRF tokens
Has robust mapping from semantic positions to GitHub comment positions

parserStrategy.desc: Baseline parser stack: Tree-sitter (Node for CLI, WASM for extension) per supported language.
acceptance: Parsers packaged per environment (node native vs wasm)
Parser selection by file extension and optional shebang/content sniffing

parserStrategy.desc: Best parser per language (SWC for TS/JS; Lightning CSS for CSS) while keeping fallback to Tree-sitter/text.
acceptance: Per-language parser priority chain: best -> baseline -> text
Capability reporting (e.g., token ranges, AST kinds, error recovery)

qualityGates.tests: vitest + @effect/vitest; all required checks run in CI and pre-commit.
qualityGates.coverage: Coverage collected; thresholds set and enforced (project-defined).

goals: Avoid pathological memory blowups (streaming where possible)
Avoid O(n^2) worst-case on common cases; degrade gracefully
Bench suite required; perf regressions detected via baseline comparison

requirements: Deterministic output and stable sort orders
Clear error messages with tagged errors (Effect) and diagnostics

architecture.style: Effect services + layers; modular packages; shared core types; strict schemas.

packages.name: @semadiff/core
packages.purpose: AST/tree model, diff operations, semantic rules engine, schemas, shared types.

packages.name: @semadiff/parsers
packages.purpose: Parser interfaces + registry + fallback chain logic.

packages.name: @semadiff/parser-tree-sitter-node
notes: Baseline parser backend; provides Layer(Parser) per language.

packages.name: @semadiff/parser-tree-sitter-wasm
notes: Same interface as node; smaller bundles per language.

packages.name: @semadiff/render-html
packages.purpose: HTML renderer + virtualization helpers for overlay.

packages.name: @semadiff/cli
packages.purpose: CLI app using @effect/cli; integrates parsers, engine, renderers.

packages.name: @semadiff/github-extension
packages.purpose: Chrome/Edge MV3 extension: content script + overlay UI + wasm parsers.

packages.name: @semadiff/test-corpus
packages.purpose: Golden fixtures + generators + refactor/move scenarios across languages.

layeringRules: Node CLI uses @effect/platform-node Layer for FS/Path/Process
Extension uses browser platform layers; no node-only deps
Parser backends are separate layers; registry composes priority+fallback
errors: All expected failures are tagged errors (Schema.TaggedError)
Defects reserved for truly impossible states; surfaced with diagnostics

parserFallbackModel.selection: by language plugin + env capabilities (node/wasm) + config priority

initialRules: Tailwind class list normalization for static class strings
import specifier stable ordering (optional; conservative default off)
numeric literal canonicalization (optional; conservative with BigInt/-0/NaN rules)

approach: Secondary: move detection pass (block matching) + nested diff inside moves
Fallback: line-based diff when parsing fails
outputs: grouping: hunks + moved blocks + rename groups
metadata: confidence scores + explanations (for explain command)

observability.model: Effect spans + OpenTelemetry exporters; zero network by default.

requirements: creates temp git repo in test
runs git diff/show/log with configured external tool
asserts exit code semantics and non-empty output for changes
Playwright runs against local static GitHub-like fixtures
Optional manual smoke test doc for real GitHub PR pages
CI compares against committed baseline with allowed regression threshold

validationChecklist: Schema validation for all public JSON outputs
No outbound network tests (unless explicitly enabled)

requirements: single command runs full lint+format check
pre-commit hook runs: lint + typecheck + tests

requiredChecks: bench regression check (on main or scheduled)

deliveryPlan.rule: No phase considered done unless all quality gates pass.

phases.goal: Scaffold repo + quality gates + Effect architecture skeleton.
includes: OTel plumbing scaffold (no exporter by default)
doneWhen: smoke diff command works with text fallback

phases.goal: CLI + Git external diff MVP with Tree-sitter baseline for web languages.
doneWhen: git external diff works end-to-end in tests

phases.goal: Semantic normalization (safe rules) + Tailwind class normalization.
includes: yaml/toml/md baseline parsing or structured fallback
doneWhen: tailwind reorder produces no diff in fixtures

phases.goal: Move detection + rename grouping + better rendering.
GitHub overlay extension MVP (read-only semantic view).
Overlay GitHub actions bridge + bug report flow.
includes: bug report diagnostics bundle + prefilled issue link

phases.goal: Best parser per language (fast path) while keeping fallback.
doneWhen: parser swap does not change public schemas
fallback still works on parser failure

phases.goal: Optional full GitHub diff replacement mode.

risks: Semantic rules accidentally hiding meaningful changes -> mitigate with conservative defaults + rule-level tests + explain mode
GitHub DOM changes breaking extension -> mitigate with fixture-driven selectors + fast patch releases + overlay-first design
Parser licensing/packaging constraints (future parsers) -> mitigate by isolating in optional packages + documented licenses
Performance regressions -> mitigate with bench baselines + CI guard

jsonSchemas.name: DiffDocument
jsonSchemas.compat: renderer and extension must support same major
